translated: The Questions of the Wanderer Sakuludāyī
The Chapter about the Pot🔽The Questions about the Antidote

original: “Bhante nāgasena, ‘agadassa dve aṅgāni gahetabbānī’ti yaṁ vadesi, katamāni tāni dve aṅgāni gahetabbānī”ti.
analyzed: bhante nāgasena agadassa dve aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti yam vadesi katamāni tāni dve aṅgāni gahetabbāni iti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, when you say two factors of the antidote should be taken up, which are these two factors that should be taken up?”

analyzed: yathā mahā rāja agade kimī na saṇṭhahanti
translated: “As, sire, the antidote does not allow the poison to spread,

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena mānase kilesā na saṇṭhapetabbā.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena mānase kilesāḥ na saṇṭhapetabbā
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should not allow the defilements to spread in the mind.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, agadassa paṭhamaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: idam mahā rāja agadassa paṭhamam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the first factor of the antidote that should be taken up.

original: Puna caparaṁ, mahārāja, agado daṭṭhaphuṭṭhadiṭṭhaasitapītakhāyitasāyitaṁ sabbaṁ visaṁ paṭihanati;
analyzed: puna capara mahā rāja agadaḥ daṭṭha phuṭṭha diṭṭha asita pīta khāyita sāyitam sabbam visam paṭihanati
translated: “And again, sire, the antidote destroys all poison whether it is seen, or touched, or tasted, or smelt;

original: evameva kho, mahārāja, yoginā yogāvacarena rāgadosamohamānadiṭṭhivisaṁ sabbaṁ paṭihanitabbaṁ.
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja yoginā yogāvacarena rāga dosa moha māna diṭṭhi visam sabbam paṭihanitabba
translated: even so, sire, the one who is devoted to mental training should destroy all the poison of lust, hatred, delusion, conceit and false view.

original: Idaṁ, mahārāja, agadassa dutiyaṁ aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ.
analyzed: ida mahā rāja agadassa dutiyam aṅgam
translated: This, sire, is the second factor of the antidote that should be taken up.

original: Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā devātidevena—🔽‘Saṅkhārānaṁ sabhāvatthaṁ,🔽daṭṭhukāmena yoginā;
analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā devātidevena  saṅkhārānam sabhāvattha  daṭṭhu kāmena yoginā
translated: And this, sire, was said by the Blessed One, the god over all gods:🔽‘The one who is devoted to mental training🔽And wants to see the nature of things,
the destruction of the poison of defilements.”
The fifth section for recitation on the antidote is finished.
